title: JSON Schema for Beef Database code-generation (https://github.com/Avanade/Beef).

CodeGeneration.title: 'CodeGeneration' object (database-driven)
CodeGeneration.description: The `CodeGeneration` object defines global properties that are used to drive the underlying database-driven code generation.

schema.title: The name of the `Schema` where the artefacts are defined in, or should be created in, the database.
schema.description: This is used as the default `Schema` for all child objects.

replace.title: Indicates whether the existing database object should be replaced/altered or whether the object is dropped and recreated.

columnNameIsDeleted.title: The column name for the `IsDeleted` capability.

columnNameTenantId.title: The column name for the `TenantId` capability.

columnNameOrgUnitId.title: The column name for the `OrgUnitId` capability.

columnNameRowVersion.title: The column name for the `RowVersion` capability.

columnNameCreatedBy.title: The column name for the `CreatedBy` capability.

columnNameCreatedDate.title: The column name for the `CreatedDate` capability.

columnNameUpdatedBy.title: The column name for the `UpdatedBy` capability.

columnNameUpdatedDate.title: The column name for the `UpdatedDate` capability.

columnNameDeletedBy.title: The column name for the `DeletedBy` capability.

columnNameDeletedDate.title: The column name for the `DeletedDate` capability.

orgUnitJoinSql.title: The SQL table or function that is to be used to join against for security-based `OrgUnitId` verification.

checkUserPermissionSql.title: The SQL stored procedure that is to be used for `Permission` verification.

getUserPermissionSql.title: The SQL function that is to be used for `Permission` verification.

aliasColumns.title: The list of `Column` and `Alias` pairs (split by a `^` lookup character) to enable column aliasing/renaming.
aliasColumns.description: Each alias value should be formatted as `Column` + `^` + `Alias`; e.g. `PCODE^ProductCode`.

autoDotNetRename.title: The option to automatically rename the SQL Tables and Columns for use in .NET.
autoDotNetRename.description: Defaults `SnakeKebabToPascalCase` that will remove any underscores or hyphens separating each word and capitalize the first character of each; e.g. `internal-customer_id` would be renamed as `InternalCustomerId`. The `PascalCase` option will capatilize the first character only.

preprocessorDirectives.title: Indicates whether to use preprocessor directives in the generated output.

collectionType.title: The collection type.
collectionType.description: Values are `JSON` being a JSON array (preferred) or `UDT` for a User-Defined Type (legacy). Defaults to `JSON`.

efModel.title: Indicates whether an `Entity Framework` .NET (C#) model is to be generated for all tables.
efModel.description: This can be overridden within the `Table`(s).

outbox.title: Indicates whether to generate the event outbox SQL and .NET artefacts.

outboxSchema.title: The schema name of the event outbox table.

outboxSchemaCreate.title: Indicates whether to create the `OutboxSchema` within the database.

outboxTable.title: The name of the event outbox table.

outboxEnqueueStoredProcedure.title: The stored procedure name for the event outbox enqueue.

outboxDequeueStoredProcedure.title: The stored procedure name for the event outbox dequeue.

pathBase.title: The base path (directory) prefix for the Database-related artefacts; other `Path*` properties append to this value when they are not specifically overridden.
pathBase.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter). For example `Beef.Demo`.

pathDatabaseSchema.title: The path (directory) for the Schema Database-related artefacts.

pathDatabaseMigrations.title: The path (directory) for the Schema Database-related artefacts.

pathBusiness.title: The path (directory) for the Business-related (.NET) artefacts.

orgUnitImmutable.title: Indicates whether the `OrgUnitId` column is considered immutable, in that it can not be changed once set.
orgUnitImmutable.description: This is only applicable for stored procedures.

namespaceBase.title: The base Namespace (root) for the .NET artefacts.
namespaceBase.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter). For example `Beef.Demo`.

namespaceCommon.title: The Namespace (root) for the Common-related .NET artefacts.

namespaceBusiness.title: The Namespace (root) for the Business-related .NET artefacts.

namespaceOutbox.title: The Namespace (root) for the Outbox-related Publisher .NET artefacts.

Table.title: 'Table' object (entity-driven)
Table.description: The `Table` object identifies an existing database `Table` (or `View`) and defines its code-generation characteristics.

name.title: The name of the `Table` in the database.

schema.title: The name of the `Schema` where the `Table` is defined in the database.

alias.title: The `Schema.Table` alias name.
alias.description: Will automatically default where not specified.

replace.title: Indicates whether the existing database object should be replaced/altered or whether the object is dropped and recreated.

includeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be included in the underlying generated output.
includeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates that all `Columns` are to be included.

excludeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be excluded from the underlying generated output.
excludeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates no `Columns` are to be excluded.

aliasColumns.title: The list of `Column` and `Alias` pairs (split by a `^` lookup character) to enable column aliasing/renaming.
aliasColumns.description: Each alias value should be formatted as `Column` + `^` + `Alias`; e.g. `PCODE^ProductCode`.

jsonAliasColumns.title: The list of JSON `Column` and `JsonAlias` pairs (split by a `^` lookup character) to enable column aliasing/renaming.
jsonAliasColumns.description: Each alias value should be formatted as `Column` + `^` + `Alias`; e.g. `ProductCode^product`.

get.title: Indicates whether a `Get` stored procedure is to be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

getAll.title: Indicates whether a `GetAll` stored procedure is to be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.
getAll.description: The `GetAllOrderBy` is used to specify the `GetAll` query sort order.

getAllOrderBy.title: The list of `Column` names (including sort order `ASC`/`DESC` literal) to be used as the `GetAll` query sort order.

create.title: Indicates whether a `Create` stored procedure is to be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

update.title: Indicates whether a `Update` stored procedure is to be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

upsert.title: Indicates whether a `Upsert` stored procedure is to be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

delete.title: Indicates whether a `Delete` stored procedure is to be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

merge.title: Indicates whether a `Merge` (insert/update/delete of `Udt` list) stored procedure is to be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.
merge.description: This will also require a `Udt` (SQL User Defined Table) and `Tvp` (.NET Table-Valued Parameter) to function.

efModel.title: Indicates whether an `Entity Framework` .NET (C#) model is to be generated.

udt.title: Indicates whether a `User Defined Table (UDT)` type should be created.

udtExcludeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be excluded from the `User Defined Table (UDT)`.
udtExcludeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates that no `Columns` are to be excluded.

tvp.title: The name of the .NET entity associated with the `Udt` so that it can be expressed (created) as a Table-Valued Parameter for usage within the corresponding `DbMapper`.

collectionType.title: The collection type.
collectionType.description: Values are `JSON` being a JSON array (preferred) or `UDT` for a User-Defined Type (legacy). Defaults to `Config.CollectionType`.

permission.title: The permission (prefix) to be used for security permission checking (suffix defaults to `Read`, `Write` or `Delete` and can be overridden in the underlying stored procedure).

orgUnitImmutable.title: Indicates whether the `OrgUnitId` column is considered immutable, in that it can not be changed once set.
orgUnitImmutable.description: Defaults to `CodeGeneration.OrgUnitImmutable`. This is only applicable for stored procedures.

columnNameIsDeleted.title: The column name for the `IsDeleted` capability.

columnNameTenantId.title: The column name for the `TenantId` capability.

columnNameOrgUnitId.title: The column name for the `OrgUnitId` capability.

columnNameRowVersion.title: The column name for the `RowVersion` capability.

columnNameCreatedBy.title: The column name for the `CreatedBy` capability.

columnNameCreatedDate.title: The column name for the `CreatedDate` capability.

columnNameUpdatedBy.title: The column name for the `UpdatedBy` capability.

columnNameUpdatedDate.title: The column name for the `UpdatedDate` capability.

columnNameDeletedBy.title: The column name for the `DeletedBy` capability.

columnNameDeletedDate.title: The column name for the `DeletedDate` capability.

StoredProcedure.title: 'StoredProcedure' object (database-driven)
StoredProcedure.description: The code generation for an `StoredProcedure` is primarily driven by the `Type` property. This encourages (enforces) a consistent implementation for the standardised **CRUD** (Create, Read, Update and Delete) actions, as well as supporting `Upsert`, `Merge` and ad-hoc queries as required.

name.title: The name of the `StoredProcedure`; generally the verb/action, i.e. `Get`, `Update`, etc.
name.description: See `StoredProcedureName` for the actual name used in the database.

paging.title: Indicates whether standardized paging support should be added.
paging.description: This only applies where the stored procedure operation `Type` is `GetColl`.

replace.title: Indicates whether the existing `StoredProcedure` database object should be replaced/altered or whether the object is dropped and recreated.

reselectStatement.title: The SQL statement to perform the reselect after a `Create`, `Update` or `Upsert` stored procedure operation `Type`.
reselectStatement.description: Defaults to `[{{Table.Schema}}].[sp{{Table.Name}}Get]` passing the primary key column(s).

intoTempTable.title: Indicates whether to select into a `#TempTable` to allow other statements access to the selected data.
intoTempTable.description: A `Select * from #TempTable` is also performed (code-generated) where the stored procedure operation `Type` is `GetColl`.

withHints.title: the table hints using the SQL Server `WITH()` statement; the value specified will be used as-is; e.g. `NOLOCK` will result in `WITH(NOLOCK)`.

collectionType.title: The collection type.
collectionType.description: Values are `JSON` being a JSON array (preferred) or `UDT` for a User-Defined Type (legacy). Defaults to `Table.CollectionType`.

mergeOverrideIdentityColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be used in the `Merge` statement to determine whether to _insert_, _update_ or _delete_.
mergeOverrideIdentityColumns.description: This is used to override the default behaviour of using the primary key column(s).

permission.title: The name of the `StoredProcedure` in the database.

orgUnitImmutable.title: Indicates whether the `OrgUnitId` column is considered immutable, in that it can not be changed once set.

includeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be included in the underlying generated _settable_ output (further filters `Table.IncludeColumns`).
includeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates that all `Columns` are to be included. Only filters the columns where `Type` is `Get`, `GetColl`, `Create`, `Update` or `Upsert`.

excludeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be excluded from the underlying generated _settable_ output (further filters `Table.ExcludeColumns`).
excludeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates no `Columns` are to be excluded. Only filters the columns where `Type` is `Get`, `GetColl`, `Create`, `Update` or `Upsert`.

Parameter.title: 'Parameter' object (database-driven)
Parameter.description: The `Parameter` is used to define a stored procedure parameter and its charateristics. These are in addition to those that are automatically inferred (added) by the selected `StoredProcedure.Type`.

column.title: The corresponding column name; used to infer characteristics.

sqlType.title: The SQL type definition (overrides inherited Column definition) including length/precision/scale.

nullable.title: Indicates whether the parameter is nullable.
nullable.description: Note that when the parameter value is `NULL` it will not be included in the query.

treatColumnNullAs.title: Indicates whether the column value where NULL should be treated as the specified value; results in: `ISNULL([x].[col], value)`.

collection.title: Indicates whether the parameter is a collection (one or more values to be included `IN` the query).

collectionType.title: The collection type.
collectionType.description: Values are `JSON` being a JSON array (preferred) or `UDT` for a User-Defined Type (legacy). Defaults to `StoredProcedure.CollectionType`.

Where.title: 'Where' object (database-driven)
Where.description: The `Where` object defines an additional where `Statement` to be added. This is in addition to those automatically added based on the `StoredProcedure.Type`.

OrderBy.title: 'OrderBy' object (database-driven)
OrderBy.description: The `OrderBy` object defines the query order. Only valid for `StoredProcedure.Type` of `GetAll`.

name.title: The name of the `Column` to order by.

Execute.title: 'Execute' object (database-driven)
Execute.description: The _Execute_ object enables additional TSQL statements to be embedded within the stored procedure.

location.title: The location of the statement in relation to the underlying primary stored procedure statement.

Relationship.title: 'Relationship' object (database-driven)
Relationship.description: The `Relationship` object enables the definition of an entity framework (EF) model relationship.

name.title: The name of the primary table of the query.

schema.title: The schema name of the primary table of the view.

type.title: The relationship type between the parent and child (self).

foreignKeyColumns.title: The list of `Column` names from the related table that reference the parent.

principalKeyColumns.title: The list of `Column` names from the principal table that reference the child.
principalKeyColumns.description: Typically this is only used where referencing property(s) other than the primary key as the principal property(s).

onDelete.title: The operation applied to dependent entities in the relationship when the principal is deleted or the relationship is severed.
onDelete.description: Defaults to `NoAction`. See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.entityframeworkcore.deletebehavior for more information.

autoInclude.title: Indicates whether to automatically include navigation to the property.

propertyName.title: The corresponding property name within the entity framework (EF) model.

efModelName.title: The corresponding entity framework (EF) model name (.NET Type).

Query.title: 'Query' object (database-driven)
Query.description: The `Query` object enables the definition of more complex multi-table queries (`Joins`) that would primarily result in a database _View_. The primary table `Name` for the query is required to be specified. Multiple queries can be specified for the same table(s). The `IncludeColumns` and `ExcludeColumns` provide a shorthand to include or exclude selected columns; with the `AliasColumns` providing a means to rename where required (for example duplicate name). Additional `Where` and `Order` configuration can also be added as required.

name.title: The name of the primary table of the query.

schema.title: The schema name of the primary table of the view.

alias.title: The `Schema.Table` alias name.
alias.description: Will automatically default where not specified.

includeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be included in the underlying generated output.
includeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates that all `Columns` are to be included.

excludeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be excluded from the underlying generated output.
excludeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates no `Columns` are to be excluded.

aliasColumns.title: The list of `Column` and `Alias` pairs (split by a `^` lookup character) to enable column aliasing/renaming.
aliasColumns.description: Each alias value should be formatted as `Column` + `^` + `Alias`; e.g. `PCODE^ProductCode`

view.title: Indicates whether a `View` is to be generated.

viewReplace.title: Indicates whether the existing `View` database object should be replaced/altered or whether the object is dropped and recreated.

permission.title: The permission to be used for security permission checking.
permission.description: The suffix is optional, and where not specified will default to `.READ`.

columnNameIsDeleted.title: The column name for the `IsDeleted` capability.

columnNameTenantId.title: The column name for the `TenantId` capability.

columnNameOrgUnitId.title: The column name for the `OrgUnitId` capability.

columnNameRowVersion.title: The column name for the `RowVersion` capability.

columnNameCreatedBy.title: The column name for the `CreatedBy` capability.

columnNameCreatedDate.title: The column name for the `CreatedDate` capability.

columnNameUpdatedBy.title: The column name for the `UpdatedBy` capability.

columnNameUpdatedDate.title: The column name for the `UpdatedDate` capability.

columnNameDeletedBy.title: The column name for the `DeletedBy` capability.

columnNameDeletedDate.title: The column name for the `DeletedDate` capability.

QueryJoin.title: 'QueryJoin' object (database-driven)
QueryJoin.description: The `QueryJoin` object defines a join to another (or same) table within a query. The `Type` defines the join type, such as inner join, etc. The `IncludeColumns` and `ExcludeColumns` provide a shorthand to include or exclude selected columns; with the `AliasColumns` providing a means to rename where required (for example duplicate name).

name.title: The name of the table to join.

schema.title: The schema name of the table to join.

alias.title: The `Schema.Table` alias name.
alias.description: Will automatically default where not specified.

includeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be included in the underlying generated output.
includeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates that all `Columns` are to be included.

excludeColumns.title: The list of `Column` names to be excluded from the underlying generated output.
excludeColumns.description: Where not specified this indicates no `Columns` are to be excluded.

aliasColumns.title: The list of `Column` and `Alias` pairs (split by a `^` lookup character) to enable column renaming.
aliasColumns.description: Each alias value should be formatted as `Column` + `^` + `Alias`; e.g. `PCODE^ProductCode`

columnNameIsDeleted.title: The column name for the `IsDeleted` capability.

columnNameTenantId.title: The column name for the `TenantId` capability.

columnNameOrgUnitId.title: The column name for the `OrgUnitId` capability.

columnNameRowVersion.title: The column name for the `RowVersion` capability.

columnNameCreatedBy.title: The column name for the `CreatedBy` capability.

columnNameCreatedDate.title: The column name for the `CreatedDate` capability.

columnNameUpdatedBy.title: The column name for the `UpdatedBy` capability.

columnNameUpdatedDate.title: The column name for the `UpdatedDate` capability.

columnNameDeletedBy.title: The column name for the `DeletedBy` capability.

columnNameDeletedDate.title: The column name for the `DeletedDate` capability.

QueryJoinOn.title: 'QueryJoinOn' object (database-driven)
QueryJoinOn.description: The `QueryJoinOn` object defines the join on characteristics for a join within a query.

name.title: The name of the join column (from the `Join` table).

toSchema.title: The name of the other join to table schema.
toSchema.description: Defaults to `Table.Schema`; i.e. same schema. See also `ToTable` and `ToColumn` as these all relate.

toTable.title: The name of the other join to table.
toTable.description: Defaults to `Table.Name`; i.e. primary table. See also `ToSchema` and `ToColumn` as these all relate.

toColumn.title: The name of the other join to column.
toColumn.description: Defaults to `Name`; i.e. assumes same name. See also `ToSchema` and `ToTable` as these all relate.

toStatement.title: The fully qualified name (`Alias.Name`) of the other column being joined to or other valid SQL (e.g. function) bypassing the corresponding `Schema`, `Table` and `Column` logic.

QueryOrder.title: 'QueryOrder' object (database-driven)
QueryOrder.description: The `QueryOrder` object that defines the query order.

name.title: The name of the `Column` to order by.
name.description: See also `Schema` and `Table` as these all relate.

schema.title: The name of order by table schema. See also `Name` and `Column` as these all relate.

table.title: The name of the order by table.
table.description: Defaults to `Table.Name`; i.e. primary table. See also `Schema` and `Column` as these all relate.

QueryWhere.title: 'QueryWhere' object (database-driven)
QueryWhere.description: The `QueryWhere` object defines an additional where `Statement` to be added.
